column4: Is anyone else here familiar with problems with gnome-power-management and laptop brightness in  ubuntu 8.10 ??
Hi, if anyone here is free, experienced with ubuntu, and willing to help a new ubuntu lover, please PM me
what is the abbrevation  PPA
How do you download someone's public PPA package
what are you trying to do specifically?

my laptop crashes/becomes unresponsive when I use FN keys on my laptop and I found a  solution on a forum on launchpad, but the solution requires  me to download something that someone has built from a PPA  site and I don't really understand this stuff since  i just started using ubuntu yesterday
link me to where you are getting your info please :)
go to http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-966869.html and search wgrant =)   Thanks
Just a moment.. no probs :)
i'm there
choose the "Third-Party Software" tab and add this repository (ppa) "https://launchpad.net/~wgrant/+archive" without the quotes of course :)
everything from http to archive
1 sec =D
sure
once you add that reload your package lists and update :)
if you need any more help just ring :P
i'm having trouble adding it
how so?
when i put the link in, add source is still greyed out
silly me
my mistake
lol it's okay, Thanks a lot for the help i really appreciate it
hey are you using 8.10 (intrepid) ?
yes
the problem that i have, only occurs in intepid i believe (from research)
ok add this "deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/wgrant/ubuntu intrepid main"  and  "deb-src http://ppa.launchpad.net/wgrant/ubuntu intrepid main"
both links?
add both seperately
can you please tell me the difference between deb and deb-src?
deb-src is source code
just in case
sometimes it may be required
done  :)
currently reloading
sorry to bother you some more, but what do i do here
sure thing
has it notified you to tell you updates are available?
it notified me that an adobe flash update was availible, but i'm guessing that is not what i am looking for
but i installed reguardless
go to 'Applications > Accessories > Terminal" and type "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade -y"
are  those 2 seperate commands or can  i  perform that in 1 line?
1 line that is what the && is for :)
i never knew! ty =D i that will  be important to me
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
ok do "sudo apt-get install gnome-power-manager"
Very sorry for taking up so much of your time
hey thats what I am here for :)
gnome-power-manager is already the newest version.
sudo apt-get autoremove
do "apt-cache policy gnome-power-manager"
done. Should i somehow check my gnome-power-manager version to see if i have the new one wgrant built?
which repository  does it say it is coming from?
and which version number is printed?
gnome-power-manager:
it happens
did my message go through?
you got that pastebin link I think I missed the bulk of info
http://paste.ubuntu.com/93026/
remember when you told me to perform  sudo apt-get autoremove, something called xutils-dev was removed, can you tell me what just happened?
it seems to be installed.. could you reboot and see if it made any difference
it removed old dependencies
dependencies?
sorry me newb =(
yeah other libraries and such that are required to run
Thank you for everything, i'll reboot and come back and let you  know  the result
one more thing before i go
should i remove the 2 repositories i added after i reboot and see it's working?
but aren't the repositories i added just personally modified versions of programs by wgrant?
I am confused?? Isn't it better to have updates from original ubuntu repositories rather than someone's personal custom versions?
yeah.. but the one in the official repositories is not the one wgrants ppa offers
so my understanding is i should keep this  repository from wgrant, until the official ubuntu repositories have an official update that fixes gnome-power-manager that covers this problem
well yeah.. that is if you are monitoring the situation
like subscribing to the particular bug report you are effected by
i'll stop bugging you and restart now! thanks for everything
I'm back and sad to say it did not fix my problems........... So from here it is best if i remove the 2 repositories I've added and continue searching for  another solution?
I think that package did not install
I believe you may have to remove your existing gnome-power-manager
would that be in add/remove ?
or would i have to do it through terminal?
go to 'System > Administration > Synaptic Package Manager
close synaptic and open a terminal
i see 1 gnome-power-manager
cleaner to just purge it
yeah thats okl
sudo apt-get purge gnome-power-manager
I find this method cleaner.. but you can use synaptic if you want
it is complete =D
when done reboot and then "sudo apt-get install gnome-power-manager"
i'll perform that after i reboot, then i'll reboot again and see if it works, then i'llcome back with results
ty again
i hope you're still there
You there?
I are you back yet?
hey
